title: [Suggestion] [Low Priority] Change output of suggestion to use -k / --insecure for added clarity
body:
When `curl` has an SSL certificate verification problem (mine was exit code `60` in this specific case), the output is slightly confusing. It prints out

```
curl: (60) SSL certificate problem: unable to get local issuer certificate
More details here: https://curl.haxx.se/docs/sslcerts.html

curl performs SSL certificate verification...
 ...
If this HTTPS server uses a...
 ...
If you'd like to turn off curl's verification of the certificate, use
 the -k (or --insecure) option.
```

For some reason I thought this entire message was coming from `curl`, but only the first two lines were.  The rest is output by `spack`.  It should have been obvious, but I pulled out the man page of `curl` first and found `-K` and thought it was a typo, rather than me being stupid.

I'm suggesting making the final output message a little more explicit

```
If you'd like to turn off curl's verification of the certificate, use
 the -k (or --insecure) option.
```

changes to

```
If you'd like to turn off curl's verification of the certificate, call
 spack with the -k (or --insecure) option.
```

AKA "If you'd like to turn off curl's verification of the certificate, ~use~[call spack with] the -k (or --insecure) option."

I'm probably the only person who has done this, and it didn't take long to figure it out, but I thought it may save somebody 5 minutes one day ;)
